channel.title: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?
channel.description: I'm working on a Bukkit plugin.. should I commit the dependencies to GitHub, or not?

item.title: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Commit them for deployment, not for development.

Read full topic

@whackatre wrote:

don’t commit them unless you want people to yell at you.

item.title: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

They’re jars but the sources for the jars are on GitHub (I reference the CraftBukkit jar and the PermissionsEx jar)

Read full topic
item.source: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?

item.title: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Take a look here: https://github.com/ForestryMC/ForestryMC

The api folder and lang folder do not exist in the repository, but are actually references to different repositories, and defined in .gitmodules

Read full topic
item.source: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?

item.title: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:545509”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=664394.msg4441410#msg4441410 date=1406760902]

I’m working on a Bukkit plugin… should I commit the dependencies to GitHub, or not?

You could reference them as git modules.

wut
[/quote]

If the dependency source is stored on a repository, he could use a git submodule so that when people check out his code, it downloads them from their owner’s repositories, instead of his.[/quote]

Demonstration?

Read full topic
item.source: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?

I’m working on a Bukkit plugin… should I commit the dependencies to GitHub, or not?

You could reference them as git modules.
[/quote]

wut[/quote]

If the dependency source is stored on a repository, he could use a git submodule so that when people check out his code, it downloads them from their owner’s repositories, instead of his.

item.title: Should I commit my dependencies to GitHub?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:3, topic:545509”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=664394.msg4441389#msg4441389 date=1406755730]

I’m working on a Bukkit plugin… should I commit the dependencies to GitHub, or not?

You could reference them as git modules.
[/quote]

How do I do that and what’s the difference between doing that and committing the dependencies?[/quote]

I guess what I should ask first is, are they binary dependencies(jars) or source dependencies hosted somewhere?

Read full topic
